Steps.StepString: Started the CTF challenge with a note stating 'under protection' indicating the platform has some security measures

Substeps.SubstepString: Noticed a note that stated 'under protection', indicating the presence of security measures on the platform.

Steps.StepString: Suspected it had something to due with security protections such as a WAF after noting the title 'advertisement' and the presence of protected DIG records

Substeps.SubstepString: Speculated a connection with security protections such as WAF after noting certain factors.
Identified the presence of protected DIG records.

Steps.StepString: Suspected it could be related to Cloudflare protections after examining DIG records

Substeps.SubstepString: Formulated a suspicion of possible Cloudflare protections.

Steps.StepString: Considered triggering a custom Cloudflare error, but didn't know how to do it

Substeps.SubstepString: Contemplated on triggering a custom Cloudflare error.
Lacked the knowledge on how to trigger the aforementioned error.

Steps.StepString: Recalled an example from a known website (crunchyroll.com) where a Cloudflare error was triggered by SQL injection

Substeps.SubstepString: Recalled an instance from a known website (crunchyroll.com).
Remembered that a Cloudflare error was triggered in the instance by SQL injection.

Steps.StepString: Tried using an SQL injection on the challenge platform (inputting ' OR 1=1--')

Substeps.SubstepString: Due to the previous step, made an attempt to use an SQL injection on the challenge platform.

Steps.StepString: Received a custom error with the flag as a response, resulting in successful completion of the challenge

Substeps.SubstepString: Received a custom error as a response to the SQL injection.
The flag was found in the error, leading to successful completion of the challenge.
